title: Capitolium 2 Small Caps
content:
Gerard Unger's multi-award winning typeface now features small caps in all of its styles. After the release of [Capitolium 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415045458/http:/www.type-together.com/Capitolium%202) and [Capitolium News 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415045458/http:/www.type-together.com/Capitolium%202), which take advantage of OpenType possibilities and feature a broader language coverage –including accents for northern and central Europe languages– editorial designers from around the globe started to ask for small cap support... You asked for it, we deliver!

[Contact us](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415045458/http:/www.type-together.com/index.php?action=portal/viewContent&cntId_content=2668&id_section=138#frm_contacto) for an upgrade!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415045458im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Capitolium2_SC2_5928.gif)
author: typetogether

comments.content: Is the word 'breath' in your sample a typo? Also, with no contrast to uc and lc that sample does not (to me) scream 'small caps', simply 'all caps'.
Typetogether, the links for the two fonts, Capitolium 2 and Capitolium News 2, go to the same place.
